bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, September 3, 1918

div1.p: Blue sends Carter to Galveston, Texas, in order to investigate dengue fever and to Tampico, Mexico, in order to inspect sanitary conditions.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, September 3, 1918
div1.opener:
JKC
LA
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
Sept. 3, 1918.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
Bureau telegram of this date,
“Proceed via Bureau and Galveston, Texas, to
Tampico, Mexico. Desire you investigate outbreak
dengue at Galveston”,
is hereby confirmed.

You will come to the Bureau for conference and then proceed
to Galveston, Texas, and investigate an outbreak of dengue
and upon the completion of that duty, proceed to Tampico, Mexico,
for the purpose of investigating sanitary conditions at that port.
Upon the completion of duty in Tampico, you will rejoin your station
at Baltimore.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. J
JAC
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing instructions
are hereby authorized.
JH. Moyle
Assistant Secretary.
RB
